permafrost.tundra.lang

Class ArrayHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • permafrost.tundra.lang.ArrayHelper

  • public class ArrayHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    A collection of convenience methods for working with arrays.

    • Method Summary

      • drop

        public static <T> T[] drop(T[] array,
                           int index)
        Removes the element at the given index from the given list.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class of the items stored in the array.
        Parameters:
        array - An array to remove an element from.
        index - The zero-based index of the element to be removed.
        Returns:
        A new array whose length is one item less than the given array, and which includes all elements from the given array except for the element at the given index.

      • get

        public static <T> T get(T[] array,
                        int index)
        Returns the element from the given array at the given index (supports ruby-style reverse indexing).
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class of the items stored in the array.
        Parameters:
        array - An array to retrieve an item from.
        index - The zero-based index of the item to be retrieved; supports ruby-style reverse indexing where, for example, -1 is the last item and -2 is the second last item in the array.
        Returns:
        The item stored in the array at the given index.

      • resize

        public static <T> T[] resize(T[] array,
                             int newLength)
        Resizes the given array to the desired length, and pads with nulls.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class of the items stored in the array.
        Parameters:
        array - The array to be resized, must not be null.
        newLength - The new length of returned array, which can be less than the given array's length in which case it will be truncated, or more than the given array's length in which case it will be padded to the new size with the given item (or null if no item is specified).
        Returns:
        A new array with the items from the given array but with the new desired length.

      • resize

        public static <T> T[] resize(T[] array,
                             int newLength,
                             T item,
                             java.lang.Class<T> klass)
        Resizes the given array (or instantiates a new array, if null) to the desired length, and pads with the given item.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class of the items stored in the array.
        Parameters:
        array - The array to be resized. If null, a new array will be instantiated.
        newLength - The new length of returned array, which can be less than the given array's length in which case it will be truncated, or more than the given array's length in which case it will be padded to the new size with the given item (or null if no item is specified).
        item - The item to use when padding the array to a larger size.
        klass - The class of the items stored in the array.
        Returns:
        A new array with the items from the given array but with the new desired length.

      • resize

        public static <T> T[] resize(T[] array,
                             int newLength,
                             T item)
        Resizes the given array to the desired length, and pads with the given item.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class of the items stored in the array.
        Parameters:
        array - The array to be resized, must not be null.
        newLength - The new length of returned array, which can be less than the given array's length in which case it will be truncated, or more than the given array's length in which case it will be padded to the new size with the given item (or null if no item is specified).
        item - The item to use when padding the array to a larger size.
        Returns:
        A new array with the items from the given array but with the new desired length.

      • fill

        public static <T> T[] fill(T[] array,
                           T item,
                           int index,
                           int length)
        Fills the given array with the given item for the given range.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class of item stored in the array.
        Parameters:
        array - The array to be filled.
        item - The item to fill the array with.
        index - The zero-based index from which the fill should start; supports ruby-style reverse indexing where, for example, -1 is the last item and -2 is the second last item in the array.
        length - The number of items from the given index to be filled.
        Returns:
        The given array filled with the given item for the given range.

      • grow

        public static <T> T[] grow(T[] array,
                           int count,
                           T item,
                           java.lang.Class<T> klass)
        Grows the size of the given array by the given count, and pads with the given item.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class of the items stored in the array.
        Parameters:
        array - The array to be resized, must not be null.
        count - The number of additional items to be appended to the end of the array.
        item - The item to use to pad the array.
        klass - The class of the items stored in the array.
        Returns:
        A new array with the items from the given array but with a new length equal to the old length + count.

      • shrink

        public static <T> T[] shrink(T[] array,
                             int count)
        Shrinks the size of the given array by the given count.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class of the items stored in the array.
        Parameters:
        array - The array to be shrunk.
        count - The number of items to shrink the array by.
        Returns:
        A new array with the items from the given array but with a new length equal to the old length - count.

        Returns true if the given item is found in the given array.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class of the items stored in the array.
        Parameters:
        array - The array to be searched for the given item.
        item - The item to be searched for in the given array.
        Returns:
        True if the given item was found in the given array, otherwise false.

      • insert

        public static <T> T[] insert(T[] array,
                             T item,
                             int index,
                             java.lang.Class<T> klass)
        Returns a new array with the given item inserted at the given index.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class of the items stored in the array.
        Parameters:
        array - The array which is to be copied to a new array.
        item - The item to be inserted.
        index - The zero-based index at which the item is to be inserted; supports ruby-style reverse indexing where, for example, -1 is the last item and -2 is the second last item in the array.
        klass - The class of the items stored in the array.
        Returns:
        A new array which includes all the items from the given array, with the given item inserted at the given index, and existing items at and after the given index shifted to the right (by adding one to their indices).

      • intersect

        public static <T> T[] intersect(T[]... arrays)
        Returns a new array that contains only the items present in all the given arrays.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class of the items stored in the arrays.
        Parameters:
        arrays - One or more arrays to be intersected.
        Returns:
        A new array which is a set intersection of the given arrays.

      • join

        public static <T> java.lang.String join(T[] array,
                                        java.lang.String separator)
        Returns a string created by concatenating each element of the given array, separated by the given separator string.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class of items stored in the array.
        Parameters:
        array - The array whose contents are to be joined.
        separator - An optional separator string to be used between items of the array.
        Returns:
        A string representation of the given array created by concatenating together the string representation of each item in order, optionally separated by the given separator string.

      • put

        public static <T> T[] put(T[] array,
                          T item,
                          int index,
                          java.lang.Class<T> klass)
        Sets the element from the given array at the given index (supports ruby-style reverse indexing).
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class of the items stored in the array.
        Parameters:
        array - The array in which to set the item at the given index.
        item - The item to be set at the given index in the array.
        index - The zero-based index of the array item whose value is to be set; supports ruby-style reverse indexing where, for example, -1 is the last item and -2 is the second last item in the array.
        klass - The class of the items stored in the array.
        Returns:
        The given array with the item at the given index set to the given value.

      • reverse

        public static <T> T[] reverse(T[] array)
        Returns a new array with all elements from the given array but in reverse order.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class of the items stored in the array.
        Parameters:
        array - The array to be reversed.
        Returns:
        A copy of the given array but with all item orders reversed.

      • slice

        public static <T> T[] slice(T[] array,
                            int index,
                            int length)
        Returns a new array which is a subset of elements from the given array.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class of the items stored in the array.
        Parameters:
        array - The array to be sliced.
        index - The zero-based start index of the subset; supports ruby-style reverse indexing where, for example, -1 is the last item and -2 is the second last item in the array.
        length - The desired length of the slice; supports negative lengths for slicing backwards from the end of the array.
        Returns:
        A new array which is a subset of the given array taken at the desired index for the desired length.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The class of items stored in the array.
        Parameters:
        array - The array to be sorted.
        Returns:
        A new copy of the given array but with the items sorted in their natural order.
